form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reed introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To provide for the treatment and extension of temporary financing of short-time compensation programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Layoff Prevention Extension Act of 2015.

section.header: Extension of temporary financing of short-time compensation payments in States with programs in law

paragraph.text: Subsection (b) of section 2162 of the Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012 (26 U.S.C. 3304 note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking 3 years and inserting 5 years; and

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Three-year and inserting Five-year; and
by striking 156 weeks and inserting 260 weeks.

paragraph.text: The amendments made by paragraph (1) shall take effect as if included in the enactment of such section 2162.
Section 3306(v)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (26 U.S.C. 3306) is amended by inserting or the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act after 1998.
The amendment made by paragraph (1) shall take effect on the day that is 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Extension of deadline for submitting an application for grants for short-time compensation programs

subsection.text: Subsection (c)(1) of section 2164 of the Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012 (26 U.S.C. 3304 note) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2016.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect as if included in the enactment of such section 2164.
